result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Carla R Lackey was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: DA has 30 days to prepare/submit order.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent. Not use/possess alcohol (Maintain absolute sobriety.).

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1569  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.Def may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply. Credit does NOT apply.

records.addlTxt:
01:41 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Aaron L. Abram on behalf of Attorney Kira Leigh Visser.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of Guilty to Count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #3. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #2.

Victim rights compliance.

COUNT #1    
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.    

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 6 months in DCJ, w/Huber and good time, to commence f/w 
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL & agent approval
-Not use/possess alcohol (Absolute Sobriety)
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Restitution: (State has 30 days to prepare an order)
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
$600 Fine + cc
-DNA surcharge waived. Fine, CC , and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-Revocation of drivers license for 36 months 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for 36 months
-1/2 Price IID
-AODA assessment (Defendant may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC) 

CREDIT:
-Days credit for time served: 3 days
-Days credit if revoked: 3 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes given to bailiff

5/25/22 AMENDED MINUTES 
Fine, CC and VW surcharge are due on probation. -Cassandra S
ADA Lillian Nelson appeared for the State. Attorney Kira Visser appeared in person with Defn. Plea/Sent scheduled, NIH
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
